On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Alpha Garkain
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Grievous Presence
entries: Any non-undead creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the garkain must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws and vulnerability to all damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the vampire's Grievous Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stain
entries: If a humanoid is wounded by the vampire, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or contract a supernatural disease. The diseased target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the disease reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. The disease lasts until removed by a lesser restoration spell or other magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire can use its Stun Blast. It then makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 17}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Stun Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire releases psychic energies in a 60-foot cone, provided that it isn't in sunlight. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Bag of Amber
entries: The satyr possesses a bag of amber beads, collected from the sap of ancestral treants in the Feywild. He can use the amber beads as a bag of beans, choosing the effect he wants. If the bag is lost or destroyed, the satyr must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only an amber father satyr can use a bag of amber.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The satyr can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Verses of Rebirth
entries: The satyr can recite the verses of rebirth while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the verses regains the maximum number of hit points possible if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest and makes all Constitution saving throws with advantage for 24 hours. The satyr can confer this benefit on himself as well. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on the satyr become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested and grow twice as fast.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The satyr makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a ram attack.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Amber Bead
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Sleep Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The satyr exhales sleep gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if it takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The amygdala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psionic Veil
entries: The amygdala is {@condition invisible} to all creatures. This effect can't be dispelled, circumvented, or suppressed by any conventional means or magic. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed}, are immune to psychic damage, or suffer from a form of madness are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The amygdala can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unknowable
entries: The amygdala can't be targeted by divination magic, perceived through magical scrying sensors, or detected by abilities that sense aberrations.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The amygdala makes three slam attacks. If the amygdala is grappling a creature, the amygdala can also use its tentacles once. It can use Iridescent Ray in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). The amygdala has six arms, each of which can grapple one creature.

action.name: Iridescent Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) radiant damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the amygdala must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and and acquires a {@table short-term madness|DMG} randomly determined which lasts for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the madness on itself on a success. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't mad.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The leshen's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}). The leshen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the leshen fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The leshen's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The leshen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The leshen regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the leshen takes fire damage this trait doesn't function at the start of the leshen's next turn.

trait.name: Totem Stride
entries: Once on its turn, the leshen can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one of his totem within its reach and emerge from a second totem within its territory, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second totem.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leshen makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Roots Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The leshen targets up to two creatures that it can see within 90 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and being {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}) on a failed save. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. When a creature ends its turn {@condition restrained} by this power it takes an extra 22 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage as the roots contract to crush it.

action.name: Call Primal Beast (4/Day)
entries: The leshen chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning. The leshen can summon {@dice 1d6} {@creature Primal Murder Of Crows}, {@dice 1d3 + 1} {@creature Primal Wolf||Primal Wolves} or 1 {@creature Primal Bear}. A summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the leshen, acts as an ally of its leshen. It remains for l hour, until it or its leshen dies, or until the leshen dismisses it as an action.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: The leshen makes one claws attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The leshen casts a spell from its list of Innate Spellcasting, using a daily use as normal.

legendary.name: Flock of Crows (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The leshen turns into a flock of crows and teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Call Lightning (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The leshen targets one creature that it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: The Marking
entries: Some Leshen and Ancient Leshen can "mark" a humanoid living in the same region, leaving them alive and unhindered by the creature's magic until it needs to sap energy from them. This can allow the leshen to bring itself back to life after being slain. When it dies, the leshen can sap the life energy from its marked host, killing them and using their energy to rejuvenate. The only known way to prevent it is to kill the marked host before killing the leshen or to exile that person out of the leshen's territory. A leshen with this option has the following additional trait:

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the leshen is killed, if the humanoid it marked is alive and in the region of the leshen's lair, it starts to reform in the woods over the course of 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. If both the leshen and the marked host are simultaneously dead, it can't rejuvenate.

trait.name: The King in Green (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the king can enter a blessed state at the start of his turn. The blessing lasts for 1 minute or until the king is {@condition incapacitated}. While blessed, the king gains the following benefits:

items: The king sheds bright green light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Any creature in the area of the light can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.
The king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
When the king makes a Charisma or Strength check, he can replace the number he rolls with a 15.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: When the king hits with a melee weapon, it deals one extra die of the weapon's damage, plus an additional 6 damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king makes three solais attacks.

action.name: Solais
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d6 + 13}) slashing damage. {@item Solais|BoBH} is a +3 silvered magic weapon.

action.name: Blessed Fury {@recharge 5}
entries: The king uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage of the following types (king's choice): lightning, radiant, or thunder.

reaction.name: Goddess' Protection
entries: In response to being hit by an attack, the king reduces the damage to 0 and each creature within 5 feet of the king takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: King's Blessing
entries: The king bestows his blessing on one ally he can see within 30 feet of him. The ally has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws it makes until the start of the king's next turn.

legendary.name: Imperious Blow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The king makes a Solais attack. If it hits, the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the king until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Word of Peace (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The king speaks with the voice of the goddess. Each creature within 30 feet of the king that can hear him must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for an hour. While {@condition charmed} by the king, a creature becomes indifferent about creatures that it is hostile toward. A creature is no longer {@condition charmed} if it is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the effect ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the king's Word of Peace for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Arch-wraith
languages: the languages it knew in life
telepathy limitless in its Domain of Dread

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The wraith can magically sense the presence of living creatures anywhere in its Domain of Dread. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The wraith is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three attacks, only one of which can be a Grave's Touch attack.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}32 ({@damage 5d8 + 10}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Grave's Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) cold damage and the target's must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, becoming {@condition petrified}, encased in ice, until the end of its next turn on a failure.

action.name: Ray of Decay
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Ray of Decay
entries: The wraith uses its Ray of Decay.

legendary.name: Whirlwind (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The arch-wraith turns into a frigid whirlwind, draining away the life of nearby creatures. All creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

legendary.name: Dead Silence (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The arch-wraith can rob a creature within 120 feet of it from its senses, leaving it in pitch-black darkness. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, becoming {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} on failure for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The abomination's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}). The abomination can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The abomination has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft ., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Balefire Burst
entries: The abomination targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) acid damage plus 31 ({@damage 7d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Flames of Change {@recharge 5}
entries: The abomination uses Balefire Burst, and on a failed save, the creature is also warped with magical deformities. While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on any ability check, saving throw, and attack that uses Strength or Dexterity. If the deformed creature dies, it instantly transforms into a living warp spawn. The deformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration spell or similar magic can end the deformation. The transformation of the body into a warp spawn can be undone only by a wish spell.

monster.name: Balewing
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Otherworldly Presence
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the balewing and can see it, the balewing can force the creature to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw if the balewing isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature acquires a short-term madness randomly determined which lasts for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the madness on a success. A creature which already has a short-term madness, is immune to psychic damage, or which has succeeded on a saving throw to this balewing's Otherworldly Presence in the last 24 hours is immune.

trait.name: Magic Attack
entries: The balewing's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balewing has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The balewing makes four melee attacks; one with its bite and three with its tendrils. It can use Hurl Balefire in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hurl Balefire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15ft., one target. Hit 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

action.name: Eldritch Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The balewing exhales arcs of energy in an 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 5d10}) lightning damage and 28 ({@damage 5d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated, as per the disintegrate spell.

variant.name: Balewing (Sickening Glow)
entries: Some aberrations radiate of the sickening glow of the warpstone. Thankfully these creature are pretty easy to identify, manifesting the same light-absorbing quality as the warpstone itself. A creature with that option has the additional trait:

entries.name: Sickening Glow
entries: Any creature other than an aberration, a construct or an undead that starts its turn within 20 feet of the aberration or enters the affected area for the first time on a turn must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw Constitution saving throw or contract the {@disease Warp Touch|BoBH} disease. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to the aberration's Sickening Glow for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the banisher dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 82 ({@damage 15d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
entries: The banisher has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If the banisher is subjected to a spell or magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The banisher makes two force strike attacks.

action.name: Force Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Force Unleash {@recharge 5}
entries: The banisher emits destructive energy in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is pushed 30 feet away from the banisher and is knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Spell Return
entries: In response to a creature casting a spell targeting the banisher, the banisher redirects it against the caster, turning the caster into the target.

legendary.name: Force Strike
entries: The banisher uses Force Strike.

legendary.name: Poison Essence
entries: The banisher targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the next spell cast by the target deals to the target {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage per level of the spell.

legendary.name: Banish Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The banisher emits an aura of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on the banisher, until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Siphon Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The banisher targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The banisher rolls a {@dice d8}, and the target loses a spell slot of that level or lower. If the target has no spell slots left of that level or lower, nothing happens.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the berserker hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Islander's Fortitude (2/Day)
entries: If damage reduces the berserker to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the berserker drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The berserker can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with {@item navigator's tools|PHB}. The berserker is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the berserker is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Unbridled Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the berserker can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the berserker is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the berserker gains the following benefits:

items: The berserker has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the berserker gains a +3 bonus to the damage roll.
The berserker has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Retaliation
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the berserker can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

reaction.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: When a creature the berserker can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the berserker, the berserker can intimidate it. If the creature can see the berserker, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of berserker's next turn.

variant.name: Optional: Seeing Red
entries: Berserkers are notably unpredictable warriors, prompt to fly into mindless rage in the battlefield, caring not if their axes are slaying friends or foes. At your option, berserkers might have the following trait.

entries.name: Seeing Red
entries: When the berserker reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the berserker must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the berserker must make a melee attack against a random target within its reach on its next turn. If it has no targets within its reach even after moving, it loses its action on that turn.

items.name: Seeing Red
entries: When the berserker reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the berserker must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the berserker must make a melee attack against a random target within its reach on its next turn. If it has no targets within its reach even after moving, it loses its action on that turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The leshen's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The leshen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The leshen's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The leshen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the black root is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in {@dice 1d4} hours and emerge from the roots of its blighted tree unless a greater restoration or wish spell is cast on the tree and the corpses of the children are given a proper burial.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leshen makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain {@recharge 5}
entries: The leshen targets up to three creatures that it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage, and the leshen regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets.

monster.name: Bloated Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the zombie is destroyed, it explodes in a burst of acid and guts. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Spew Bile {@recharge 5}
entries: The zombie spews bile in 15-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Bloated Zombie (Infected)
entries: Some zombies can transmit a terrible affliction that will in time kill anyone they wound, turning it into one of the undead.

entries.name: Infestation
entries: When a living creature is wounded by a zombie, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The diseased target can't regain hit points, and it gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} for every 24 hours that elapse. If the target dies, it rises as a zombie in the following turn. The disease lasts until removed by the {@spell lesser restoration} spell or other magic.

trait.name: Bone Spikes
entries: A creature that touches the ghast or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage. While the ghast is {@condition frightened}, this trait doesn't function.

trait.name: Lesser Regeneration
entries: The ghast regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghast makes three melee attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite. When its shriek is available, it can use the shriek in place of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Shriek {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the ghast that can hear its shriek and that isn't an undead must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the ghast's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the bone ghast's shriek for the next 24 hours.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The satyr's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The satyr can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The satyr can use his action to polymorph into a specific Medium humanoid or a Medium or Large beast with horns, or back into its true form. Other than his size and speed, his statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. He reverts to its true form if he dies.

trait.name: Faun Resilience
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Glamoured Illusion
entries: When he casts an illusion spell, the satyr can choose one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real. He can change the object on its turn as a bonus action while the spell is ongoing. The object remains real for 10 minutes. The object can't deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the satyr fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The satyr can use its Whims of Chaos and makes three attacks: one with his ram and two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Beast or Satyr Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ram (Beast or Satyr Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Whims of Chaos
entries: The satyr invokes the following magical effects at random, choosing one to three targets it can see within 60 feet of it:

items.name: Inebriated
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or if it moves on its turn it falls {@condition prone} and it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of the satyr's next turn.

items.name: Hallucinating
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of its allies and {@condition charmed} by its enemies until the start of the satyr's next turn.

items.name: Compelled
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the satyr for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed}, the target must follow the satyr's commands. If the target takes damage, the effect ends.

items.name: Talentless
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or until the start of the satyr's next turn whenever it makes an attack roll, an ability check or a saving throw, the target must roll a {@dice d8} and subtract the number rolled from the result.

legendary.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: The satyr makes one unarmed strike.

legendary.name: Glamour Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The satyr casts one of his at-will spells. The satyr doesn't need to concentrate on this spell.

legendary.name: Consuming Dance (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The satyr targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the satyr, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and then start to dance furiously for 1 minute, unless the creature can't be {@condition charmed}.

A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is engulfed in flames and also burns for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.
If damage from this effect kills a target, the target is turned to ash.

trait.name: Deathly Echoes
entries: After the botchling uses its Wail, there is a 50 percent chance that it will summon {@dice 1d3} {@creature specter||specters} or one {@creature shade|BoBH}. A summoned creature materializes within 30 feet of the botchling in an unoccupied space. The creature acts as an ally of the botchling. The creature vanishes when it drops to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Feverish Hunger
entries: As a bonus action, the botchling can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that is {@condition unconscious}. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against this magic or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage. The botchling regains a number of hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it.

action.name: Wail (Recharges 4-6)
entries: The botchling lets out a horrific wail. Any creature within 60 feet of the botchling that can hear the wail must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the botchling's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bruxa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The bruxa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn .

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph in to a Medium female humanoid or back into its true form. While in humanoid form, its statistics, are the same. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

items.name: Blood Addiction
entries: In the presence of the blood of a fey creature the vampire fails automatically blood frenzy saving throws.

items.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire uses its Otherworldly Gaze and makes two melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Bite (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Otherworldly Gaze
entries: The vampire targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition blinded} until the end of the bruxa's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration.

action.name: Eerie Scream {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire releases a eerie scream, provided that it isn't in sunlight. This scream has no effect on construct and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking 45({@dice 10d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, its also {@condition frightened} until the end of the bruxa's next turn.

variant.name: Kiss of Darkness
entries: Some of the most talented bruxae learn the ability to enthrall a person with a kiss, much in the same way other vampires use their gaze to do so. A bruxa with the kiss of darkness option has a challenge rating of 10 (5,900 XP). When a humanoid or an undead kisses a bruxa, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the vampire until the vampire dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the vampire's control and can't take reactions, and the vampire and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the vampire.

variant.name: Night Mother
entries: Night mothers grow in power and occult knowledge over the centuries. A bruxa night mother has a challenge rating of 12 (8,400 XP) and the following additional traits and action options:

entries.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bruxa is a 10th-level spellcaster. her spellcasting ability is Charisma (save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The bruxa has the following spells prepared:

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The bruxa can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The bruxa regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

entries.name: Otherworldly Gaze
entries: The bruxa uses its Otherworldly Gaze.

entries.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bruxa makes one bite attack.

entries.name: The bruxa makes one bite attack.
entries: The bruxa cast a spell from her list of Innate Spellcasting or Spellcasting feature, using a daily use or a spell slot as normal.

items.name: Kiss of Darkness
entries: Some of the most talented bruxae learn the ability to enthrall a person with a kiss, much in the same way other vampires use their gaze to do so. A bruxa with the kiss of darkness option has a challenge rating of 10 (5,900 XP). When a humanoid or an undead kisses a bruxa, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the vampire until the vampire dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the vampire's control and can't take reactions, and the vampire and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the vampire.

items.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bruxa is a 10th-level spellcaster. her spellcasting ability is Charisma (save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The bruxa has the following spells prepared:

legendary.name: Otherworldly Gaze
entries: The bruxa uses its Otherworldly Gaze.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bruxa makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: The bruxa makes one bite attack.
entries: The bruxa cast a spell from her list of Innate Spellcasting or Spellcasting feature, using a daily use or a spell slot as normal.

monster.name: Cenokian Wraith
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Faces of Terror
entries: Any creature who targets the wraith with an attack or a harmful spell must first succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Forbiddance
entries: The wraith can't enter a residence if its owner has marked the main door with lamb's blood.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three spectral claw attacks.

action.name: Spectral Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) necrotic damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage if the target is {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Absorb Soul
entries: The wraith chooses a living humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 5 feet of it. The target's soul is magically trapped inside the wraith, the wraith regains 20 hit points, immediately recharges Death Grasp, and gains an additional action on its next turn. While the soul is trapped, the target's body and all the equipment it is carrying cease to exist. The soul is freed if the wraith drops to 0 hit points, or the wraith frees it as an action, at which point the target's body reforms in an unoccupied space nearest to the wraith and in the same state as when it was trapped.

action.name: Death Grasp {@recharge 5}
entries: The wraith reaches into the body of a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 47 ({@damage 6d8 + 20}) necrotic damage. On a failed save, the target drops to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Death Mark
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed until the end of the wraith's next turn. Until the curse ends, the target is vulnerable to necrotic damage and can't regain hit points.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The wraith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Insanity (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one {@condition frightened} creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the wraith, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and gain a random form of short-term madness (roll on the {@table Short-Term Madness|DMG} table in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) for 1 minute. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the madness.

trait.name: Devastating Charge
entries: If the chort moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an antler attack on the same turn, the target takes and extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}, in which case the chort can make another attack with its claws against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The chort regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chort use its Third Eye and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Third Eye
entries: The chort magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. If it fails, it comes under one of the following effects, chosen at random:

items.name: Asleep
entries: The target falls {@condition unconscious}. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature uses its action to shake the sleeper awake.

items.name: Panicked
entries: The target is {@condition frightened}. On each of its turns, the {@condition frightened} creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the chort by the safest and shortest available route, unless there is nowhere to move. If the target moves to a place at least 60 feet away from the chort where it can no longer see it, this effect ends.

items.name: Sickened
entries: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 17 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The minotaur makes two melee attacks, only one of which can be a gore attack. If an attack hits, it can cause it to create an additional effects of his choice (each effect can be used only once per Multiattack):
The attack deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the minotaur's next turn.
If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking the damage of the attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or die.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The minotaur makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Charge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The minotaur moves up to its speed, then make a gore attack.

legendary.name: Stir Rage (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The minotaur targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On failure, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and uses its reaction to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, it moves up to its speed to get closer to the nearest creature.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The warrior has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The warrior can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with {@item navigator's tools|PHB}. The warrior is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the warrior can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warrior makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Boarding Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) and pulled 10 feet toward the warrior. If this bring the {@condition grappled} creature within 5 feet of the warrior, the warrior can make a melee weapon attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The crone can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium female humanoid or back into its true form. While in humanoid form, its statistics, are the same. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The crone is immune to spells of 5th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The crone's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crone uses its Mistress of Hexes and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw (Crone Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mistress of Hexes
entries: The crone magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it comes under one of the following effects, chosen by the crone:

1. Boiling Blood. The blood of the target starts boiling in its veins. It becomes {@condition incapacitated} with excruciating pain until the end of the crone's next turn. At the beginning of the creature's turn, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

2. Doomed. The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and has vulnerability to one type of damage of the crone's choice. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

3. Leech. The target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the beginning of its turn, and the crone regains hit points equal to that amount. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

4. Twisted. The hex twists horribly the appearance of the target. The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}, and its Charisma score becomes 1 until the curse is removed by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The crone makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Mistress of Hexes (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The crone use its Mistress of Hexes power.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The crone cast a spell from its list of Innate Spellcasting (if any), using a daily use as normal.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crone's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). The crone can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries.name: Black Fog {@recharge}
entries: A magical fog obscures the area and brings the dead with it. A 120-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within 120 feet of the crone appears. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The crone chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning. The crone can summon {@dice 1d6} {@creature Drowner|BoBH|drowners}, {@dice 1d3 + 1} {@creature Foglet|BoBH|foglets} or 1 {@creature Crypt Horror|BoBH}. A summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within the fog and acts as an ally of its crone. It remains for l minute, until it or its crone dies, or until the crone dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: The crone regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Uncanny Strength
entries: The crone melee attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18–20. A creature taking damage from the attack suffers from a {@table Lingering Injuries|DMG|Lingering Injury} (See p. 272 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

entries.name: Witch Sabbath {@recharge}
entries: The crone chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning. The crone can summon {@dice 1d4} {@creature sea hag||sea hags}, {@dice 1d2} {@creature green hag||green hags} or 1 {@creature night hag}. A summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the crone, acts as an ally of its crone. It remains for l minute, until it or its crone dies, or until the crone dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crone's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). The crone can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries.name: Etherealness
entries: The crone magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

entries.name: Unravel Destiny {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}33 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) psychic damage. The target must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be afflicted with {@table short-term madness|DMG} (p. 259 in the Dungeon Master's Guide).

entries: The crone summons 1 {@creature Chort|BoBH}. A summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the crone, and acts as an ally of its crone. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its crone dies, or until the crone dismisses it as an action.
