spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crone's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). The crone can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Crushing Might
entries: Once per turn, when the crypt horror hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can deal an extra 18 ({@dice 4d8}) damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each non-undead creature that is within 60 feet of the crypt horror and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the crypt horror's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The crypt horror regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the crypt horror takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the crypt horror's next turn. The crypt horror is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
entries: The crypt horror is immune to effects that turn undead and to magical effects that prevent undead to enter an area, such as the {@spell magic circle} or {@spell hallow} spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crypt horror makes three melee attacks: two with its claw and one with its bite.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Beast Bond
entries: The ranger can cast beast bond at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Wisdom.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The ranger can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The ranger also has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ranger makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned}, the target is unable to breath. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each minute that elapses, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Skirmisher
entries: The ranger moves up to half its speed when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of it. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Quick Quaffer
entries: The alchemist can drink a potion as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The alchemist has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Volatile Mix
entries: The alchemist throws a flask at a solid surface within 40 feet of it, where the flask detonates. Roll a {@dice d4} or choose one of the following options:

1. Choker's Dust. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or choke for 1 minute. While choking, a creature is running out of breath and can't speak or cast spells with verbal components. A choking creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

2. Devil's Puffball. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

3. Samum. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of the alchemist's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

4. Vitriol. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage and takes 5 acid damage at the start of each of its turns. Dousing the target with water reduces the acid damage by 1 point per pint or flask of water used. If the saving throw is successful, the creature takes half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its turns.

reaction.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge 5}
entries: In response to taking damage, the alchemist drops a smoke bomb, releasing a cloud of smoke that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Wind disperses the cloud, which otherwise lasts for 1 minute.

variant.name: Forgotten Formulas
entries: Most alchemist do not know the secrets of these formulas, but a few have rediscovered them in ancient treatises. Feel free to add some or all of them to symbolize the alchemist's progression:

entries.name: Dream Gas
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. A creature awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it.

entries.name: Ethera
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or gain the effect of the etherealness spell until the end of the alchemist's next turn.

entries.name: Northern Wind
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage and is {@condition restrained} in ice until the end of the alchemist's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the devourer dies, it explodes in a burst of toxic fumes. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 8 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage plus 8 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Unbearable Stench
entries: Any creature other than a undead that starts its turn within 5 feet of the rotfiend must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned}, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devourer makes two rotting fist attacks.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Dluur
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dluur can breathe air and water.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dluur remains motionless in water under the surface, it is indistinguishable from a normal patch of lure weed.

trait.name: Lure
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the dluur and can see the dluur's illicium, the dluur can force the creature to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw if the dluur isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition charmed}, the creature must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as close as its speed allows toward the dluur. The effect ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dluur makes two claws attacks. It can use Acid Spit in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

reaction.name: Psychic Assault
entries: When a creature the dluur can see starts its turn {@condition charmed} within 60 feet of the aberration, the dluur can attack its mind with psychic powers. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its turn.

variant.name: Dluur (Sickening Glow)
entries: Some aberrations radiate of the sickening glow of the warpstone. Thankfully these creature are pretty easy to identify, manifesting the same light-absorbing quality as the warpstone itself. A creature with that option has the additional trait:

entries.name: Sickening Glow
entries: Any creature other than an aberration, a construct or an undead that starts its turn within 20 feet of the aberration or enters the affected area for the first time on a turn must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw Constitution saving throw or contract the {@disease Warp Touch|BoBH} disease. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to the aberration's Sickening Glow for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Dolgotha
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Acid Blood
entries: When the dolgotha takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the dolgotha takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Acid Fog
entries: A 20-foot-radius sphere of acid fog surrounds the dolgotha. The fog spreads around corners. Its area is heavily obscured. When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 23 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Strong wind disperses the fog for {@dice 1d4} turns before it returns.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dolgotha can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Fog Crawler
entries: While in the fog, The dolgotha can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns and has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dolgotha makes three melee attacks; one with its beak and two with its chelipeds.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. Hit 27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Chelipeds
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the dolgotha jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target' s choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage , isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the dolgotha's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the dolgotha's space.

action.name: Corrosive Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dolgotha exhales acid in 60-foot cone. Each creature in that cone must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) acid damage on a failed save, and 23 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

variant.name: Pale One
entries: Some legendary albino dolgothas, known as pale ones, have a strong connection to the Far Realm. A pale one with an Intelligence of 14 ({@ability int 14}) and a telepathy of 120 ft. has a challenge rating of 16 (15,000 XP) and the following additional action option:

entries.name: Psychic Backslash
entries: Immediately after a creature casts an illusion or enchantment spell that targets the dolgotha or includes it in its area of effect, the dolgotha can use its reaction to absorb the magic of the spell, cancelling its effect. Additionally, the creature that casted the spell must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 1d8} psychic damage per level of the spell slot absorbed.

variant.name: Dolgotha (Sickening Glow)
entries: Some aberrations radiate of the sickening glow of the warpstone. Thankfully these creature are pretty easy to identify, manifesting the same light-absorbing quality as the warpstone itself. A creature with that option has the additional trait:

entries.name: Sickening Glow
entries: Any creature other than an aberration, a construct or an undead that starts its turn within 20 feet of the aberration or enters the affected area for the first time on a turn must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw Constitution saving throw or contract the {@disease Warp Touch|BoBH} disease. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to the aberration's Sickening Glow for the next 24 hours.

_versions.name: Pale One

items.name: Psychic Backslash
entries: Immediately after a creature casts an illusion or enchantment spell that targets the dolgotha or includes it in its area of effect, the dolgotha can use its reaction to absorb the magic of the spell, cancelling its effect. Additionally, the creature that casted the spell must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 1d8} psychic damage per level of the spell slot absorbed.

items: TP

languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The drowner has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Drowning Aura
entries: Any living, breathing creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the drowner must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature begins to drown and is {@condition restrained}. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target drops to 0 hit points. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the drowned dead's Drowning Aura for the next 24 hours. Amphibious creatures are not affected.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drowned dead makes two claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the drowner can {@condition grapple} the target (escape {@dc 13}).

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker hits the drowned dead with an attack it can use his reaction to half the damage, provided it isn't {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The drowner has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the  drowner's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the drowner can {@condition grapple} the target (escape {@dc 12}).

action.name: Drag Under
entries: The drowner can drag in deep waters or mud a {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition stunned} target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or take 8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} and buried in mud. The buried target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature can take an action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check, ending the buried state on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric and druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks.

trait.name: Spirit Shape
entries: As a bonus action, the druid can magically shift to the Ethereal Plane. At the start of its next turn, it returns to the Material Plane in an unoccupied space that it can see within 30 feet of the space it vanished from.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Brand of the Prey
entries: The druid targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, beast, fey, and plant creatures are hostile to the target and have advantage on attack rolls made against it. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The huntsman's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The huntsman can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The huntsman's weapon attacks are magical. When the huntsman hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Relentless Pursuer
entries: If the huntsman has even a tiny piece of a creature or an object in its possession, such as a lock of hair or a splinter of wood, it knows the distance to and the most direct route to that creature or object, even if the creature or object and the huntsman are on different planes of existence. A creature or an item that is hidden from divination magic is immune.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The huntsman makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Eldritch Shot {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) force damage plus 18 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Summon Hounds (1/Day)
entries: The huntsman attempts to magically summon {@dice 1d4 + 1} hound of the wild hunt with a 50 percent chance of success. If the attempt fails, the huntsman takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned hounds appear in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of its summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

trait.name: Clumsy Moves
entries: While the ekhidna is neither flying nor swimming, attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The ekhidna has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The ekhidna can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ekhidna makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail constrict.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the ekhidna can't constrict another target.

action.name: Shriek
entries: Each creature within 20 feet of the ekhidna that can hear its shriek and that isn't a siren must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the ekhidna's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the ekhidna's shriek for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The vampire can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. During daylight hours the regeneration of the vampire is reduced to 10 hit points.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack, or it makes two melee attack and turn {@condition invisible} before or after the attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or lose 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to internal injuries. Each time the vampire hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 7 ({@dice 2d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The vampire magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the vampire wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

variant.name: Optional: Mimicry
entries: Ekimmaras base their perception on sound, literally "seeing" the sounds they project. Some rare subspecies have perfected this ability to the point of being able to project their voice, making it originate from a distant point. They use this ability to lure, terrify and isolate preys, cunningly waiting for a group to split up before striking.

items: The ekimmara can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices, and choose a point of origin for the sound within 120 feet of it. They can imitate perfectly the sound of someone in distress, cries of a baby or screams of pain, usually replicating the last sounds of its victims. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

variant.name: Ekimmara Scourge
entries: Some very old and powerful ekimmaras reach extraordinary level of cunning and cruelty, they are nicknamed scourge. An ekimmara scourge has a challenge rating of 12 (8,400 XP) and the following additional action options:

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The ekimmara can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ekimmara regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

entries.name: Escape
entries: The vampire use Invisibility and may move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Claws (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one attack with its claws.

entries.name: Cruel Slaughter (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes an attack with its claws against one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or die. If the target dies, each creature of the vampire's choice that is within 60 feet of it and able to see it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the vampire for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish; the GM controls the creature's movement, which is erratic. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vampire's Cruel Slaughter for the next 24 hours.

They can imitate perfectly the sound of someone in distress, cries of a baby or screams of pain, usually replicating the last sounds of its victims. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish; the GM controls the creature's movement, which is erratic. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vampire's Cruel Slaughter for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Dermal Adaptation
entries: After taking damage, the experimenter gains resistance to damage of that type, except psychic damage, until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Inner Alchemy
entries: The numerical effects and duration of potions (such as a potion of healing or a potion of speed) used by the experimenter are doubled.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The experimenter has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The experimenter makes three ranged attacks or three melee attacks,

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Injector
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or suffer one random poison effect:
1. Poison Damage: The target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) poison damage.
2. Paralysis: The target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

3. Organ Failure: The target is {@condition poisoned}, which causes it to also gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it , and ending the poison removes any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by it. Each failed save causes the target to suffer another level of {@condition exhaustion}.

variant.name: Elixirs and Serums
entries: Experimenters come to develop their own elixirs and serums. An experimenter with Kadon's Transmogrifying Serum has a challenge rating of 11 (7,200 XP). Add some of the following ones to illustrate an experimenter's progression:

entries.name: White Raffard's Elixir (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the experimenter can regain 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points and is freed from any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

entries.name: Golden Oriole Elixir (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, whenever the experimenter is subjected to poison damage within the next minute, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the poison damage dealt.

entries.name: Kadon's Transmogrifying Serum (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the experimenter assume a muscular and hideous form for 1 hour. While transformed, the experimenter gains the following benefits:

items: Its size becomes Large.
It regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.
It has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws.
It has a Strength of {@ability str 20}.
It gains the following additional action option:

items.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: White Raffard's Elixir (2/Day)

bonus.name: Golden Oriole Elixir (2/Day)

items: Its size becomes Large.
It regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.
It has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws.
It has a Strength of {@ability str 20}.
It gains the following additional action option:

items.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Faun Resilience
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The satyr makes two attacks: one with his ram and one with his greatclub.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Dark Urges
entries: The satyr touches a creature and magically knows the creature's current emotional state. If the target fails a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw, the satyr also knows the creature's alignment, and its flaw. On a failed save, the creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a failure, the satyr magically influences the creature to indulge in its flaw, with no regard for consequences. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect. The target pursues the course of action suggested to the best of its ability for 1 day. If the satyr or its allies damage the target, the effect ends. If the target successfully saves against the effect, the target is immune to this satyr's Dark Urges for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Feral Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the zombie can move up to half its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Feral Zombie (Infected)
entries: Some zombies can transmit a terrible affliction that will in time kill anyone they wound, turning it into one of the undead.

entries.name: Infestation
entries: When a living creature is wounded by a zombie, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The diseased target can't regain hit points, and it gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} for every 24 hours that elapse. If the target dies, it rises as a zombie in the following turn. The disease lasts until removed by the {@spell lesser restoration} spell or other magic.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The fianna can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The fianna also has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks.

trait.name: Harrier
entries: When the fianna makes a melee attack against a creature, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hits or not.

trait.name: Opportunist
entries: The fianna deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with an opportunity attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fianna makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Fanatical Devotion
entries: The flagellant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. While the flagellant can see a friendly, higher-ranking member of its religion, the flagellant ignores the effects of being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Flaying
entries: As a bonus action, the flagellant loses 6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2}) hit points, and gains advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls until the end of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flagellant makes two attacks: one with its flail and one with its torch.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Torch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire , the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Burn the Witch
entries: Immediately after an enemy the flagellant can see cast a spell within 90 feet of it, the flagellant can move up to its speed. It can then make one torch attack against the spellcaster.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The vampire can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Fear of Sunlight
entries: While in sunlight, the vampire is {@condition frightened} and has disadvantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Leap Attack
entries: If the vampire jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement next to a creature, then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster.name: Foglet
languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The foglet's innate spellcasting ability is wisdom. The foglet can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the foglet's body is destroyed, a will-o'-wisp appears in its space. If the will-o'-wisp escapes, after 24 hours, it will inhabit another corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points, turning into a new foglet. Destroying the will-o'-wisp prevents the foglet from returning.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The foglet makes two claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Killer Fog {@recharge 5}
entries: The foglet call forth a fog haunted by smoke doubles of itself. A 30-foot-radius fog appears, centered on a point within 60 feet of the foglet and lasting for 1 minute or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. A creature's speed is halved in the area. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage as illusory foglets attack it from every side. Foglets are immune to these effects.

trait.name: Foul Presence
entries: Any non-undead creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the vampire must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is failed by 5 or more, it's also {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the vampire's Foul Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stain

The diseased target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the disease reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. The disease lasts until removed by a lesser restoration spell or other magic.

The ghoul is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the ghoul fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
entries: The ghoul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: At-Will Spell
entries: The ghoul casts one of its at-will spells.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ghoul makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: The Hunger (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ghoul targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be magically cursed with insatiable hunger. When the cursed target sees a creature drop to 0 hit points, it must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move up to its speed towards the creature and make an unarmed strike to attempt to bite it. The cursed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

trait.name: Skulker
entries: The ghoul gains an additional action during the first round of combat. Any hit it scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ghoul can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The ghoul's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghoul makes two melee attacks: one with its claws and one with its bite or its tongue.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target has disadvantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition paralyzed}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The godling's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The godling can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Burdock Allergy
entries: The godling has a strong allergy to the burdock plant. If it comes within 20 feet of burdock flowers, it is {@condition poisoned} until it leaves the area.

trait.name: Fey Protection
entries: Any creature that attempts to damage the godling must first succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way perceives everything as hilariously funny and falls into fits of laughter and falls {@condition prone}, becoming {@condition incapacitated} and unable to stand up.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The godling has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Magic Pebble
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (2/Day)
entries: The godling touches another creature. The target magically regains 12 ({@dice 2d8 + 3}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The godling magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell , or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the godling wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

variant.name: Bucka
entries: Nothing is as pure and cruel as a child, and buckas share the same disposition. Deprived of parental love and care, they are extremely malicious, loving to cause chaos and play elaborated pranks that often result in unlikely death. Buckas can easily be differentiated from godlings, for they resemble a shriveled old person the size of child. A bucka has the game statistics of a godling, except it is chaotic evil and has the following trait instead of the godling's Innate Spellcasting:

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bucka's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The bucka can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bucka's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The bucka can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the magister fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Perfect Metal
entries: While the magister wears armor made of metal, its AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The magister has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The magister makes three attacks: two with its metal shard and one with its golden phial, and uses Rust Breeze, if it is available.

action.name: Metal Shard
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Golden Phial
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) acid damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against being {@condition petrified}. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to gold and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} for 1 hour.

action.name: Rust Breeze {@recharge 5}
entries: The magister blows rust powder in a 15-foot cone. Each creature wearing metal armor in that area must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 31 ({@damage 7d8}) piercing damage and be {@condition restrained} in their armor for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Unravel the Craft
entries: When the magister is hit by a metal weapon, it touches the weapon, destroying it if it is nonmagical. If it is a magic weapon that isn't an artifact, its properties are suppressed for 10 minutes.

legendary.name: Heat Metal
entries: The magister casts heat metal (spell save {@dc 19}). Intelligence is its spellcasting ability for this spell.

legendary.name: Final Transformation (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The magister touches one {@condition petrified} creature within 5 feet of it. The creature takes 66 ({@damage 12d10}) acid damage, ignoring resistance to damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the creature is killed by turning into molten gold.

legendary.name: Gilded Form (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The magister becomes {@condition petrified}, turning into gold until the start of its next turn. While {@condition petrified} by this effect, the magister is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

legendary.name: Blade Barrier (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The magister casts blade barrier (spell save {@dc 19}). Intelligence is its spellcasting ability for this spell.

trait.name: Banquet of Flesh
entries: When the minotaur reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to feast on the creature. The target suffers 14 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage and the minotaur regains hit points equal to that amount.

trait.name: Bloodgreed
entries: The minotaur has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The minotaur uses its Primal Fury, if available, and makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a gore attack.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Primal Fury {@recharge 4}
entries: The minotaur enters a state of furious rage. Until the end of its next turn its speed is doubled, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only) or Dash action.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grave hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The hag can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grave hag uses its Twist the Innocent, if available, and makes two attacks, only one of which can be a tongue attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. lf the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way the creature is {@condition blinded}. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Twist the Innocent {@recharge 5}
entries: The twisted specter of a child appears near the grave hag, protecting it and attacking its ennemies. The hag gains 30 temporary hit points. While it has these temporary hit points, when a creature enters a 20 feet radius area around the hag for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage as the specter slashes the target with its claws. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. If the hag takes force damage she loses all her temporary hit points, forcing the specter to retreat.

legendary.name: Tongue (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hag makes one tongue attack.

legendary.name: Command Undead
entries: The grave hag commands an undead within 60 feet of it to immediately make an attack or to make a dash action as a reaction.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The amygdala's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}). The amygdala can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the amygdala fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The amygdala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psionic Veil
entries: The amygdala is {@condition invisible} to all creatures. This effect can't be dispelled, circumvented, or suppressed by any conventional means or magic. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed}, are immune to psychic damage, or suffer from a form of madness are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The amygdala can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unknowable
entries: The amygdala can't be targeted by divination magic, perceived through magical scrying sensors, or detected by abilities that sense aberrations.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The amygdala makes four slam attacks. It can use Iridescent Ray in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}). The amygdala has six arms, each of which can grapple one creature.

action.name: Iridescent Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Eldritch Frontier {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by the amygdala must succeed on a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw or be transported to a demiplane that can be entered by no other means except a {@spell wish} spell. A creature can leave the demiplane only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the {@spell plane shift} spell. The demiplane is an infinite labyrinthine expanse of loathsome shapes, structures of dizzying heights, and cyclopean masonry filled with horrible images and hieroglyphs. If the amygdala dies, creatures it trapped inside the demiplane appear around the corpse in unoccupied spaces.

legendary.name: Dissonant Whispers
entries: The amygdala casts the {@spell dissonant whispers} spell (at 4th level).

legendary.name: Iridescent Beam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Otherwordly eyes appear on the amygdala's head and fire a beam of energy in an 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 46 ({@damage 6d6 + 25}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Delirium (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The amygdala targets up to three creatures that it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or acquires a randomly determined short-term madness which lasts until the end of the amygdala's next turn.

trait.name: Agile Flyer
entries: The great cockatrice can fly in spaces that would allow a creature of Medium size to do so. While it is airborne its AC increases by 2 and if the cockatrice is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Fragile Inner Ear
entries: The cockatrice's balance can easily be thrown off by loud sounds. If the great cockatrice takes thunder damage, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its flying speed is reduced to 0 feet until the end of its next turn. An airborne cockatrice affected by this effect descends at 60 feet per round until it reaches the ground.

trait.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the great cockatrice and the two of them can see each other, the cockatrice can force the creature to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw if the cockatrice isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the targeted creature is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cockatrice makes three melee attacks: one with its beak, one with its talons and one with its wings and tail.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against being magically {@condition petrified}. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} for 24 hours.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wings and Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls based on Strength and Dexterity until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

trait.name: Verdant Blessing
entries: The AC of the dryad includes her Charisma bonus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dryad makes two attacks.

action.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 150 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@dice 3d8 + 5}) damage of one of the following types (dryad's choice): acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison.

action.name: Verdant Ward (2/Day)
entries: A ward of green shimmering energy forms around the dryad. The dryad gains 50 temporary hit points. While she has these temporary hit points, the dryad has resistance to damage from spells. If the dryad takes force damage she loses all her temporary hit points, ending the ward.

legendary.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: The dryad makes one elemental bolt attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dryad casts a spell, using a daily use as normal.

legendary.name: Eternal Slumber (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dryad targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed and fall {@condition unconscious} into a state of suspended animation. Time ceases to flow for it, and it doesn't grow older. The curse has no effect on undead or constructs. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Verdant Touch (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dryad touches another creature. The target magically regains 23 ({@dice 4d8 + 5}) hit points and is freed from any charm, curse, disease, poison or petrification effect.

variant.name: Optional: Verdant Sorcery
entries: Some green enchantresses have a deeper connection with worldroots magic. When such dryad carries a worldroot she can channel her inner power through it. If the worldroot is lost or destroyed, the dryad cannot use her {@b verdant sorcery}, {@b verdant touch} and {@b verdant ward}. A dryad with this option has a challenge rating of 15 (13,000 XP) and the following additional trait:

entries.name: Verdant Sorcery
entries: The dryad has 10 sorcery points. She can spend 1 sorcery point as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits on her elemental bolt attack, depending on the damage type selected:

items.name: Acid:
entries: the target takes 12 ({@damage 5d4}) acid damage at the end of its next turn.

items.name: Cold:
entries: the target's speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Fire:
entries: If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

items.name: Lightning:
entries: the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Poison:
entries: the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Verdant Sorcery
entries: The dryad has 10 sorcery points. She can spend 1 sorcery point as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits on her elemental bolt attack, depending on the damage type selected:

items: {@i Acid:} the target takes 12 ({@damage 5d4}) acid damage at the end of its next turn.
{@i Cold:} the target's speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

{@i Fire:} If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
{@i Lightning:} the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
{@i Poison:} the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The griffin doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The griffin has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The griffin's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffin uses its Stunning Screech, if available and makes three melee attacks: one with its beak, one with its claws and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the griffin can't use its talons on another target.

action.name: Stunning Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The griffin emits a powerful screech. Each creature within 20 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the griffin's next turn.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: As a bonus action, the vampire can polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form. While in mist form, the vampire can't speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 60 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage.

trait.name: Enigmatic Nature
entries: The vampire is immune to effects that turn undead, as well as any divination spell that it refuses.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The vampire's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Monstrous Form (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight and if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining, the vampire immediately polymorph into a Large monstrous form for 10 minutes. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies. While in monstrous form, the vampire has the following traits:

items: The vampire cannot use its shapechanger feature and has disadvantage on blood frenzy saving throws.
The vampire gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only) or Dash action.
The vampire gains a flying speed of 150 feet.
The vampire has resistance to all damage except radiant damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 30 hit points at the start of its turn. If a magical piercing weapon made of silver is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated}, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn. The vampire dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the vampire is killed, it regains all its hit points at the next sunset unless its body was destroyed, in which case it will take {@dice 1d10} year to rejuvenate at the location of its death. If another higher vampire reduces its Constitution to 0 with its bite attack or it is killed during a total solar eclipse, the vampire is destroyed for good.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

items.name: Absent Reflection
entries: The vampire does not appear in mirrors or reflective surfaces.

items.name: Blood Addiction
entries: If the vampire used successfully its bite or blood drain attack on a creature in the past 24 hours, the vampire has disadvantage on blood frenzy saving throws.

items.name: Dalvenite Allergy
entries: The vampires is allergic to dalvenite, a costly alloy composed of meteoric steel and silver. If the vampire starts its turn within 5 feet of dalvenite it cannot use its Shapechanger and Monstrous Form feature until the end of its turn. The vampire automatically fails Strength ability checks to break dalvenite.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire and Monstrous Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 21}).

action.name: Bite (Vampire and Monstrous Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage and the target's Constitution score is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Blood Drain (Mist Form Only)
entries: One creature in the vampire's space must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw (undead and constructs automatically succeed). On a failed save, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) necrotic damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest. It dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: The vampire makes one attack with its claws.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

entries.name: Blood Sense
entries: The vampire can sense living creatures that have blood or similar vital fluids in a radius of 240 feet.

entries.name: Blood Cauldron {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire targets a living creature that have blood or similar vital fluids that it can see within 30 feet of it, making its blood boil. The target must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage plus 27 ({@damage 5d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 50 necrotic damage plus 50 fire damage.

entries.name: Blood Call (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire targets up to two living creature that have blood or similar vital fluids that it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. A target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. A target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Weave the Mortal Coil
entries: The vampire can cast {@spell raise dead} and {@spell create undead} at will, requiring no components and at any higher level it wishes to. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma.

entries.name: Wind of Death {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire summons a gust of deathly wind in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 67 ({@damage 15d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the wind reduces it to 0 hit points. A humanoid slain by the wind rises 1 minute later as a zombie under the vampire's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed.

entries.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the vampire's gaze for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Alpha Vampire
entries: The vampire can cast {@spell antipathy/sympathy} at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). This use of the spell can only affect lesser vampires.

entries.name: Feral Swarm {@recharge 5}
entries: A giant swarm of bats gather around the higher vampire and descend upon a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 32 ({@damage 7d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 32 ({@damage 7d8}) piercing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Ancient Might (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one attack with its claws. If it hits, the attack is a critical hit. A creature taking damage from the attack suffers from a {@table Lingering Injuries|DMG|Lingering Injury} (See p. 272 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

entries.name: Night Blood
entries: When it is an area of dim light or darkness the vampire is {@condition invisible}.

entries.name: Feed the Darkness {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be magically {@condition restrained} by tendrils of solid shadow. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and is transported to a random location on the Shadowfell. A creature so transported must find its own way back to its plane of existence.

entries.name: Shadow Mirror (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. Alternatively, it can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is unwilling, it must make on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, both creatures teleport, swapping places.

items.name: Blood Sense
entries: The vampire can sense living creatures that have blood or similar vital fluids in a radius of 240 feet.

items.name: Blood Cauldron {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire targets a living creature that have blood or similar vital fluids that it can see within 30 feet of it, making its blood boil. The target must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage plus 27 ({@damage 5d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 50 necrotic damage plus 50 fire damage.

items.name: Blood Call (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire targets up to two living creature that have blood or similar vital fluids that it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. A target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. A target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

items.name: Weave the Mortal Coil
entries: The vampire can cast {@spell raise dead} and {@spell create undead} at will, requiring no components and at any higher level it wishes to. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma.

items.name: Wind of Death {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire summons a gust of deathly wind in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 67 ({@damage 15d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the wind reduces it to 0 hit points. A humanoid slain by the wind rises 1 minute later as a zombie under the vampire's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed.

items.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the vampire's gaze for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Alpha Vampire
entries: The vampire can cast {@spell antipathy/sympathy} at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). This use of the spell can only affect lesser vampires.

items.name: Feral Swarm {@recharge 5}
entries: A giant swarm of bats gather around the higher vampire and descend upon a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 32 ({@damage 7d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 32 ({@damage 7d8}) piercing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Ancient Might (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one attack with its claws. If it hits, the attack is a critical hit. A creature taking damage from the attack suffers from a {@table Lingering Injuries|DMG|Lingering Injury} (See p. 272 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

items.name: Night Blood
entries: When it is an area of dim light or darkness the vampire is {@condition invisible}.

items.name: Feed the Darkness {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be magically {@condition restrained} by tendrils of solid shadow. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and is transported to a random location on the Shadowfell. A creature so transported must find its own way back to its plane of existence.

items.name: Shadow Mirror (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. Alternatively, it can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is unwilling, it must make on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, both creatures teleport, swapping places.

monster.name: Horde of Zombies
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Plagued
entries: When the swarm hits with an attack, it deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Undead Swarm Fortitude
entries: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horde uses its pull under ability if able, then uses its gnaw and claw attack.

action.name: Gnaw and Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Pull Under
entries: The horde attempts to envelope a creature within its space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and considered {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) as they are pinned to the ground under a sea of zombies. This ability can only be used if the horde is above half of its maximum hit points.

variant.name: Horde of Zombies (Infected)
entries: Some zombies can transmit a terrible affliction that will in time kill anyone they wound, turning it into one of the undead.

entries.name: Infestation
entries: When a living creature is wounded by a zombie, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The diseased target can't regain hit points, and it gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} for every 24 hours that elapse. If the target dies, it rises as a zombie in the following turn.
